thread.title: It's Home Sweet Home for UMD Women
thread.title_full: It's Home Sweet Home for UMD Women

title: It's Home Sweet Home for UMD Women
text:
It's Home Sweet Home for UMD Women 
By Zach Schneider October 15, 2015 Updated Oct 15, 2015 at 10:18 PM CDT 
Duluth, MN (NNCNOW.com) --- The University of Minnesota Duluth (UMD) women's hockey team has spent the first three weekends of the 2015-16 season on the road, but the Bulldogs will finally play games at AMSOIL Arena this Friday and Saturday. 
UMD comes home riding a four-game losing streak, prompting head coach Maura Crowell to focus on the process with her group. 
Click here to subscribe to our daily newsletter. 
That's a process sophomore defenseman Jessica Healey expects to be a bit easier with the comforts of playing at home. 
"I think we're all really excited because it's the first one of the year," Healey said. "We've been on the road, and there's a lot of hype for these games. We want to get the first goal and play with a lead." 
Friday's home opener against MSU-Mankato is scheduled for a 7:07 p.m. start, while Saturday's game will start at 3:07 p.m.
